intro: Persoonia lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf geebung, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is well adapted to the dry, nutrient-poor environments of its native habitat. Persoonia lanceolata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in supporting local wildlife.
